        re <span class="line"><!---->re <!----></span>#c26<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="#c26"><!---->#c26<!----></a> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span><br>I'm very sorry, poc does not require user interaction. The chances of reproducing on my local machines are about 50%. I provide some new information.<span class="line"><!---->I'm very sorry, poc does not require user interaction. The chances of reproducing on my local machines are about 50%. I provide some new information.<!----></span><br><br>1.<span class="line"><!---->1.<!----></span><br>I can confirm that even if these markers are turned on at the same time, they cannot be reproduced<span class="line"><!---->I can confirm that even if these markers are turned on at the same time, they cannot be reproduced<!----></span><br>--enable-blink-features=LayoutNGFlexFragmentation<span class="line"><!---->--enable-blink-features=LayoutNGFlexFragmentation<!----></span><br> --enable-blink-features=LayoutNGGridFragmentation<span class="line"><!----> --enable-blink-features=LayoutNGGridFragmentation<!----></span><br> --enable-blink-features=LayoutNGSubgrid<span class="line"><!----> --enable-blink-features=LayoutNGSubgrid<!----></span><br> --enable-blink-features=LayoutNGTableFragmentation<span class="line"><!----> --enable-blink-features=LayoutNGTableFragmentation<!----></span><br> --enable-blink-features=LayoutNGBlockInInline<span class="line"><!----> --enable-blink-features=LayoutNGBlockInInline<!----></span><br>  --enable-blink-features=LayoutNGBlockFragmentation<span class="line"><!---->  --enable-blink-features=LayoutNGBlockFragmentation<!----></span><br> --enable-blink-features=CSSContainerQueries<span class="line"><!----> --enable-blink-features=CSSContainerQueries<!----></span><br><br>2. <span class="line"><!---->2. <!----></span><br>It seems that the features required by the vulnerability are related to the features in feature1.png. Turn on all the flags mentioned above, and the content in feature1.png will not appear on the page.<span class="line"><!---->It seems that the features required by the vulnerability are related to the features in feature1.png. Turn on all the flags mentioned above, and the content in feature1.png will not appear on the page.<!----></span><br><br>3.<span class="line"><!---->3.<!----></span><br>Whether the vulnerability is reproduced has a lot to do with the execution of the following code. Analyzing the log records, it can be found that if it can be reproduced, the following code will crash immediately if it is executed(rep1.png). If not reproduced, the following code will be executed multiple times(notrep1.png).<span class="line"><!---->Whether the vulnerability is reproduced has a lot to do with the execution of the following code. Analyzing the log records, it can be found that if it can be reproduced, the following code will crash immediately if it is executed(rep1.png). If not reproduced, the following code will be executed multiple times(notrep1.png).<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><script id="code1" type="text/worklet"><span class="line"><!---->&lt;script id="code1" type="text/worklet"&gt;<!----></span><br>registerPaint('paintlet1', class {<span class="line"><!---->registerPaint('paintlet1', class {<!----></span><br>  static get inputProperties() { return ['--color']; }<span class="line"><!---->  static get inputProperties() { return ['--color']; }<!----></span><br>  paint(ctx, size, styleMap) {<span class="line"><!---->  paint(ctx, size, styleMap) {<!----></span><br>    (async function(arg_0,arg_1,arg_2){<span class="line"><!---->    (async function(arg_0,arg_1,arg_2){<!----></span><br>    /*[{"name":"arg_0","type":"PaintRenderingContext2D"},{"name":"arg_1","type":"any"},{"name":"arg_2","type":"StylePropertyMapReadOnly"}]*/<span class="line"><!---->    /*[{"name":"arg_0","type":"PaintRenderingContext2D"},{"name":"arg_1","type":"any"},{"name":"arg_2","type":"StylePropertyMapReadOnly"}]*/<!----></span><br>    console.log('-----------------registerPaint<int>--------------------');<span class="line"><!---->    console.log('-----------------registerPaint&lt;int&gt;--------------------');<!----></span><br>    console.log("---cb---idx-> 3");let arg_0_0 = arg_0;<span class="line"><!---->    console.log("---cb---idx-&gt; 3");let arg_0_0 = arg_0;<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>4.<span class="line"><!---->4.<!----></span><br>The failure of Clusterfuzz to reproduce may be due to the fact that there are many hard-coded URLs in the poc, which cannot be executed correctly in the Clusterfuzz environment. Here I provide a new Clusterfuzz-friendly test case(<span class="line"><!---->The failure of Clusterfuzz to reproduce may be due to the fact that there are many hard-coded URLs in the poc, which cannot be executed correctly in the Clusterfuzz environment. Here I provide a new Clusterfuzz-friendly test case(<!----></span>http://localhost:8000/fuzzer-testcases/fuzz-01.html<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="http://localhost:8000/fuzzer-testcases/fuzz-01.html"><!---->http://localhost:8000/fuzzer-testcases/fuzz-01.html<!----></a>)<span class="line"><!---->)<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

    <mr-autocomplete vocabularyname="project" for="targetProjectInput" role="listbox" id="chops-autocomplete-1"><!---->
      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>
      <div class="chops-autocomplete-container">
        <span class="screenreader-hidden" aria-live="polite">
          
        </span>
        <table hidden="">
          <tbody>
            
          </tbody>
        </table>
      </div>

        for LitElement.

            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }
      </style>
      <mr-click-throughs></mr-click-throughs>

              <mr-issue-details class="main-item"><!---->
      <style>

  :host {
    --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
    --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
    --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
    color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /** Converts a <button> to look like an <a> tag. */
  .linkify {
    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }
  h1, h2, h3, h4 {
    background: none;
  }
  a, chops-button, a.button, .button, .linkify {
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    text-decoration: none;
    font-weight: var(--chops-link-font-weight);
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
  }
  a:hover, .linkify:hover {
    text-decoration: underline;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    /* Links that look like buttons. */
    display: inline-flex;
    align-items: center;
    justify-content: center;
    text-decoration: none;
    transition: filter 0.3s ease-in-out, box-shadow 0.3s ease-in-out;
  }
  a.button:hover, .button:hover {
    filter: brightness(95%);
  }
  chops-button, a.button, .button {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
    background: var(--chops-white);
    border-radius: 6px;
    --chops-button-padding: 0.25em 8px;
    margin: 0;
    margin-left: auto;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    padding: var(--chops-button-padding);
  }
  chops-button i.material-icons, a.button i.material-icons, .button i.material-icons {
    display: block;
    margin-right: 4px;
  }
  chops-button.emphasized, a.button.emphasized, .button.emphasized {
    background: var(--chops-primary-button-bg);
    color: var(--chops-primary-button-color);
    text-shadow: 1px 1px 3px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.25);
  }
  textarea, select, input {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.
  */
  .medium-heading {
    font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
    font-weight: normal;
    line-height: 1;
    padding: 0.25em 0;
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    margin: 0;
    margin-top: 0.25em;
    border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
  }
  .medium-heading chops-button {
    line-height: 1.6;
  }
  .input-grid {
    padding: 0.5em 0;
    display: grid;
    max-width: 100%;
    grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
    grid-template-columns: minmax(120px, max-content) 1fr;
    align-items: flex-start;
  }
  .input-grid label {
    font-weight: bold;
    text-align: right;
    word-wrap: break-word;
  }
  @media (max-width: 600px) {
    .input-grid label {
      margin-top: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      text-align: left;
    }
    .input-grid {
      grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      grid-template-columns: 100%;
    }
  }

        mr-app {
          display: block;
          padding-top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-top: -1px; /* Prevent a double border from showing up. */

          /* From shared-styles.js. */
          --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
          --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
          --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
          font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
          color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
        }
        main {
          border-top: var(--chops-normal-border);
        }
        .snackbar-container {
          position: fixed;
          bottom: 1em;
          left: 1em;
          display: flex;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: flex-start;
          z-index: 1000;
        }
        /** Unfix <chops-snackbar> to allow stacking. */
        chops-snackbar {
          position: static;
          margin-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .project-alert {
          background: var(--chops-orange-50);
          color: var(--chops-field-error-color);
          display: block;
          font-weight: bold;
          text-align: center;
        }

              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->x<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->select the current issue<!----></span>
              <!---->
            </div>
          <!---->
            <div class="keyboard-help-section">
              <span></span><span class="help-title"><!---->Issue details<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->k<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator"> / </span>
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->j<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->prev/next issue in list<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->u<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->up to issue list<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->r<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->reply to current issue<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->Ctrl+Enter<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator"> / </span>
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->⌘+Enter<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->save issue reply (submit issue on issue filing page)<!----></span>
              <!---->
            </div>
          <!---->
            <div class="keyboard-help-section">
              <span></span><span class="help-title"><!---->Anywhere<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->/<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->focus on the issue search field<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->c<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->compose a new issue<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->s<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->star the current issue<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->?<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->show this help dialog<!----></span>
              <!---->
            </div>
          <!---->
        </div>
        
          Note: Only signed in users can star issues or add comments, and
          only project members can select issues for bulk edits.
        <p>
          Note: Only signed in users can star issues or add comments, and
          only project members can select issues for bulk edits.
        </p>

        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>

If it does not reproduce, click the refresh button to try again<span class="line"><!---->6. If it does not reproduce, click the refresh button to try again<!----></span><br><br>PS: Step 4 is not necessary, but it can improve the reproducibility.<span class="line"><!---->PS: Step 4 is not necessary, but it can improve the reproducibility.<!----></span><br><br>What is the expected behavior?<span class="line"><!---->What is the expected behavior?<!----></span><br><br>What went wrong?<span class="line"><!---->What went wrong?<!----></span><br><br>Type of crash<span class="line"><!---->Type of crash<!----></span><br>render tab<span class="line"><!---->render tab<!----></span><br><br>#Analysis<span class="line"><!---->#Analysis<!----></span><br>Come soon<span class="line"><!---->Come soon<!----></span><br><br>#Patch<span       <div class="issue-diff">
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Labels:</strong>
          
          -Security_Impact-Head -Security_Severity-High Security_Impact-None Security_Severity-Medium
          
          <br>
        <!---->
        
      </div><br>
    
        
      
        Yes, if the code can be reached by users (and those who may exploit that user), despite needing a flag to be enabled, this issue (a UAF in the renderer) should still be fixed. Because it is behind a command line flag, the impact can be changed to Security_Impact-None, meaning we in security aren't as concerned about the turnaround time for this fix. But it should should fix fixed before the test features this code is responsible for are enabled by default.  <span class="line"><!---->Yes, if the code can be reached by users (and those who may exploit that user), despite needing a flag to be enabled, this issue (a UAF in the renderer) should still be fixed. Because it is behind a command line flag, the impact can be changed to Security_Impact-None, meaning we in security aren't as concerned about the turnaround time for this fix. But it should should fix fixed before the test features this code is responsible for are enabled by default.  <!----></span><br><br>Also, because of the user interaction required to trigger, I've downgraded the severity from high to medium. I'm going to tag some security sheriffs on this to get concurrence and they are welcome to boost back up to high if they disagree.<span class="line"><!---->Also, because of the user interaction required to trigger, I've downgraded the severity from high to medium. I'm going to tag some security sheriffs on this to get concurrence and they are welcome to boost back up to high if they disagree.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        </div>

        Simple RCA<span class="line"><!---->Simple RCA<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>1. UpdateNGBlockLayout[2] call UpdateInFlowBlockLayout[1] created a scoped_refptr&lt;NGLayoutResult&gt; object<!----></span><br>2. But UpdateNGBlockLayout[2] did not save the returned temporary object, causing the temporary object to be freed<span class="line"><!---->2.         re <span class="line"><!---->re <!----></span>#c26<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="#c26"><!---->#c26<!----></a> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span><br>I'm very sorry, poc does not require user interaction. The chances of reproducing on my local machines are about 50%. I provide some new information.<span class="line"><!---->I'm very sorry, poc does not require user interaction. The chances of reproducing on my local machines are about 50%. I provide some new information.<!----></span><br><br>1.<span class="line"><!---->1.<!----></span><br>I can confirm that even if these markers are turned on at the same time, they cannot be reproduced<span class="line"><!---->I can confirm that even if these markers are turned on at the same time, they cannot be reproduced<!----></span><br>--enable-blink-features=LayoutNGFlexFragmentation<span class="line"><!---->--enable-blink-features=LayoutNGFlexFragmentation<!----></span><br> --enable-blink-features=LayoutNGGridFragmentation<span class="line"><!----> --enable-blink-features=LayoutNGGridFragmentation<!----></span><br> --enable-blink-features=LayoutNGSubgrid<span class="line"><!----> --enable-blink-features=LayoutNGSubgrid<!----></span><br> --enable-blink-features=LayoutNGTableFragmentation<span class="line"><!----> --enable-blink-features=LayoutNGTableFragmentation<!----></span><br> --enable-blink-features=LayoutNGBlockInInline<span class="line"><!----> --enable-blink-features=LayoutNGBlockInInline<!----></span><br>  --enable-blink-features=LayoutNGBlockFragmentation<span class="line"><!---->  --enable-blink-features=LayoutNGBlockFragmentation<!----></span><br> --enable-blink-features=CSSContainerQueries<span class="line"><!----> --enable-blink-features=CSSContainerQueries<!----></span><br><br>2. <span class="line"><!---->2. <!----></span><br>It seems that the features required by the vulnerability are related to the features in feature1.png. Turn on all the flags mentioned above, and the content in feature1.png will not appear on the page.<span class="line"><!---->It seems that the features required by the vulnerability are related to the features in feature1.png. Turn on all the flags mentioned above, and the content in feature1.png will not appear on the page.<!----></span><br><br>3.<span class="line"><!---->3.<!----></span><br>Whether the vulnerability is reproduced has a lot to do with the execution of the following code. Analyzing the log records, it can be found that if it can be reproduced, the following code will crash immediately if it is executed(rep1.png). If not reproduced, the following code will be executed multiple times(notrep1.png).<span class="line"><!---->Whether the vulnerability is reproduced has a lot to do with the execution of the following code. Analyzing the log records, it can be found that if it can be reproduced, the following code will crash immediately if it is executed(rep1.png). If not reproduced, the following code will be executed multiple times(notrep1.png).<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><script id="code1" type="text/worklet"><span class="line"><!---->&lt;script id="code1" type="text/worklet"&gt;<!----></span><br>registerPaint('paintlet1', class {<span class="line"><!---->registerPaint('paintlet1', class {<!----></span><br>  static get inputProperties() { return ['--color']; }<span class="line"><!---->  static get inputProperties() { return ['--color']; }<!----></span><br>  paint(ctx, size, styleMap) {<span class="line"><!---->  paint(ctx, size, styleMap) {<!----></span><br>    (async function(arg_0,arg_1,arg_2){<span class="line"><!---->    (async function(arg_0,arg_1,arg_2){<!----></span><br>    /*[{"name":"arg_0","type":"PaintRenderingContext2D"},{"name":"arg_1","type":"any"},{"name":"arg_2","type":"StylePropertyMapReadOnly"}]*/<span class="line"><!---->    /*[{"name":"arg_0","type":"PaintRenderingContext2D"},{"name":"arg_1","type":"any"},{"name":"arg_2","type":"StylePropertyMapReadOnly"}]*/<!----></span><br>    console.log('-----------------registerPaint<int>--------------------');<span class="line"><!---->    console.log('-----------------registerPaint&lt;int&gt;--------------------');<!----></span><br>    console.log("---cb---idx-> 3");let arg_0_0 = arg_0;<span class="line"><!---->    console.log("---cb---idx-&gt; 3");let arg_0_0 = arg_0;<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>4.<span class="line"><!---->4.<!----></span><br>The failure of Clusterfuzz to reproduce may be due to the fact that there are many hard-coded URLs in the poc, which cannot be executed correctly in the Clusterfuzz environment. Here I provide a new Clusterfuzz-friendly test case(<span class="line"><!---->The failure of Clusterfuzz to reproduce may be due to the fact that there are many hard-coded URLs in the poc, which cannot be executed correctly in the Clusterfuzz environment.               <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>
      <div class="chops-autocomplete-container">
        <span class="screenreader-hidden" aria-live="polite">
          
        </span>
        <table hidden="">
          <tbody>
            
          </tbody>
        </table>
      </div>
    <!----></mr-autocomplete>
            </div>
          </div>

      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>

       Note: Avoiding 2-way data binding to futureproof this code
        for LitElement.

    <mr-issue-page issueclosed=""><!---->
      <style>
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;

          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;

        @media (max-width: 840px) {

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

        From <span class="line"><!---->From <!----></span>comment #4<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="#c4"><!---->comment #4<!----></a> and its reply in <span class="line"><!----> and its reply in <!----></span>comment #6<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="#c6"><!---->comment #6<!----></a>, if the case requires the "--enable-blink-test-features" flag, it should never occur on the user environment. Because of that, the clusterfuzz does not include the flag at this moment.<span class="line"><!---->, if the case requires the "--enable-blink-test-features" flag, it should never occur on the user environment. Because of that, the clusterfuzz does not include the flag at this moment.<!----></span><br><br>If you succeeded to reproduce without the flag, please update the case. We'd be happy to look into it.<span class="line"><!---->If you succeeded to reproduce without the flag, please update the case.         Yes, if the code can be reached by users (and those who may exploit that user), despite needing a flag to be enabled, this issue (a UAF in the renderer) should still be fixed. Because it is behind a command line flag, the impact can be changed to Security_Impact-None, meaning we in security aren't as concerned about the turnaround time for this fix. But it should should fix fixed before the test features this code is responsible for are enabled by default.  <span class="line"><!---->Yes, if the code can be reached by users (and those who may exploit that user), despite needing a flag to be enabled, this issue (a UAF in the renderer) should still be fixed. Because it is behind a command line flag, the impact can be changed to Security_Impact-None, meaning we in security aren't as concerned about the turnaround time for this fix. But it should should fix fixed before the test features this code is responsible for are enabled by default.  <!----></span><br><br>Also, because of the user interaction required to trigger, I've downgraded the severity from high to medium. I'm going to tag some security sheriffs on this to get concurrence and they are welcome to boost back up to high if they disagree.<span class="line"><!---->Also, because of the user interaction required to trigger, I've downgraded the severity from high to medium. I'm going to tag some security sheriffs on this to get concurrence and they are welcome to boost back up to high if they disagree.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        re <span class="line"><!---->re <!----></span>#c26<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="#c26"><!---->#c26<!----></a> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span><br>I'm very sorry, poc does not require user interaction. The chances of reproducing on my local machines are about 50%. I provide some new information.<span class="line"><!---->I'm very sorry, poc does not require user interaction. The chances of reproducing on my local machines are about 50%. I provide some new information.<!----></span><br><br>1.<span class="line"><!---->1.<!----></span><br>I can confirm that even if these markers are turned on at the same time, they cannot be reproduced<span class="line"><!---->I can confirm that even if these markers are turned on at the same time, they cannot be reproduced<!----></span><br>--enable-blink-features=LayoutNGFlexFragmentation<span class="line"><!---->--enable-blink-features=LayoutNGFlexFragmentation<!----></span><br> --enable-blink-features=LayoutNGGridFragmentation<span class="line"><!----> --enable-blink-features=LayoutNGGridFragmentation<!----></span><br> --enable-blink-features=LayoutNGSubgrid<span class="line"><!----> --enable-blink-features=LayoutNGSubgrid<!----></span><br> --enable-blink-features=LayoutNGTableFragmentation<span class="line"><!----> --enable-blink-features=LayoutNGTableFragmentation<!----></span><br> --enable-blink-features=LayoutNGBlockInInline<span class="line"><!----> --enable-blink-features=LayoutNGBlockInInline<!----></span><br>  --enable-blink-features=LayoutNGBlockFragmentation<span class="line"><!---->  --enable-blink-features=LayoutNGBlockFragmentation<!----></span><br> --enable-blink-features=CSSContainerQueries<span class="line"><!----> --enable-blink-features=CSSContainerQueries<!----></span><br><br>2. <span class="line"><!---->2. <!----></span><br>It seems that the features required by the vulnerability are related to the features in feature1.png. Turn on all the flags mentioned above, and the content in feature1.png will not appear on the page.<span class="line"><!---->It seems that the features required by the vulnerability are related to the features in feature1.png. Turn on all the flags mentioned above, and the content in feature1.png will not appear on the page.<!----></span><br><br>3.<span class="line"><!---->3.<!----></span><br>Whether the vulnerability is reproduced has a lot to do with the execution of the following code. Analyzing the log records, it can be found that if it can be reproduced, the following code will crash immediately if it is executed(rep1.png). If not reproduced, the following code will be executed multiple times(notrep1.png).<span class="line"><!---->Whether the vulnerability is reproduced has a lot to do with the execution of the following code. Analyzing the log records, it can be found that if it can be reproduced, the following code will crash immediately if it is executed(rep1.png). If not reproduced, the following code will be executed multiple times(notrep1.png).<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><script id="code1" type="text/worklet"><span class="line"><!---->&lt;script id="code1" type="text/worklet"&gt;<!----></span><br>registerPaint('paintlet1', class {<span class="line"><!---->registerPaint('paintlet1', class {<!----></span><br>  static get inputProperties() { return ['--color']; }<span class="line"><!---->  static get inputProperties() { return ['--color']; }<!----></span><br>  paint(ctx, size, styleMap) {<span class="line"><!---->  paint(ctx, size, styleMap) {<!----></span><br>    (async function(arg_0,arg_1,arg_2){<span class="line"><!---->    (async function(arg_0,arg_1,arg_2){<!----></span><br>    /*[{"name":"arg_0","type":"PaintRenderingContext2D"},{"name":"arg_1","type":"any"},{"name":"arg_2","type":"StylePropertyMapReadOnly"}]*/<span class="line"><!---->    /*[{"name":"arg_0","type":"PaintRenderingContext2D"},{"name":"arg_1","type":"any"},{"name":"arg_2","type":"StylePropertyMapReadOnly"}]*/<!----></span><br>    console.log('-----------------registerPaint<int>--------------------');<span class="line"><!---->    console.log('-----------------registerPaint&lt;int&gt;--------------------');<!----></span><br>    console.log("---cb---idx-> 3");let arg_0_0 = arg_0;<span class="line"><!---->    console.log("---cb---idx-&gt; 3");let arg_0_0 = arg_0;<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>4.<span class="line"><!---->4.<!----></span><br>The failure of Clusterfuzz to reproduce may be due to the fact that there are many hard-coded URLs in the poc, which cannot be executed correctly in the Clusterfuzz environment. Here I provide a new Clusterfuzz-friendly test case(<span class="line"><!---->The failure of Clusterfuzz to reproduce may be due to the fact that there are many hard-coded URLs in the poc, which cannot be executed correctly in the Clusterfuzz environment. Here I provide a new Clusterfuzz-friendly test case(<!----></span>http://localhost:8000/fuzzer-testcases/fuzz-01.html<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="http://localhost:8000/fuzzer-testcases/fuzz-01.html"><!---->http://localhost:8000/fuzzer-testcases/fuzz-01.html<!----></a>)<span class="line"><!---->)<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

           issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      <style>

         * is disabled for this component.

      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>
      <div class="chops-autocomplete-container">
        <span class="screenreader-hidden" aria-live="polite">
          
        </span>
        <table hidden="">
          <tbody>
            
          </tbody>
        </table>
      </div>
    <!----></mr-autocomplete>

        for LitElement.

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>

        From <span class="line"><!---->From <!----></span>comment #4<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="#c4"><!---->comment #4<!----></a> and its reply in <span class="line"><!----> and its reply in <!----></span>comment #6<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="#c6"><!---->comment #6<!----></a>, if the case requires the "--enable-blink-test-features" flag, it should never occur on the user environment. Because of that, the clusterfuzz does not include the flag at this moment.<span class="line"><!---->, if the case requires the "--enable-blink-test-features" flag, it should never occur on the user environment. Because of that, the clusterfuzz does not include the flag at this moment.<!----></span><br><br>If you succeeded to reproduce without the flag, please update the case. We'd be happy to look into it.<span class="line"><!---->If you succeeded to reproduce without the flag, please update the case.       <div class="issue-diff">
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Labels:</strong>
          
          -Security_Impact-Head -Security_Severity-High Security_Impact-None Security_Severity-Medium

      </div><br>
    
        
      
        Yes, if the code can be reached by users (and those who may exploit that user), despite needing a flag to be enabled, this issue (a UAF in the renderer) should still be fixed. Because it is behind a command line flag, the impact can be changed to Security_Impact-None, meaning we in security aren't as concerned about the turnaround time for this fix. But it should should fix fixed before the test features this code is responsible for are enabled by default.  <span class="line"><!---->Yes, if the code can be reached by users (and those who may exploit that user), despite needing a flag to be enabled, this issue (a UAF in the renderer) should still be fixed. Because it is behind a command line flag, the impact can be changed to Security_Impact-None, meaning we in security aren't as concerned about the turnaround time for this fix. But it should should fix fixed before the test features this code is responsible for are enabled by default.  <!----></span><br><br>Also, because of the user interaction required to trigger, I've downgraded the severity from high to medium. I'm going to tag some security sheriffs on this to get concurrence and they are welcome to boost back up to high if they disagree.<span class="line"><!---->Also, because of the user interaction required to trigger, I've downgraded the severity from high to medium. I'm going to tag some security sheriffs on this to get concurrence and they are welcome to boost back up to high if they disagree.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>

        Simple RCA<span class="line"><!---->Simple RCA<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>1.         re <span class="line"><!---->re <!----></span>#c26<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="#c26"><!---->#c26<!----></a> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span><br>I'm very sorry, poc does not require user interaction. The chances of reproducing on my local machines are about 50%. I provide some new information.<span class="line"><!---->I'm very sorry, poc does not require user interaction. The chances of reproducing on my local machines are about 50%. I provide some new information.<!----></span><br><br>1.<span class="line"><!---->1.<!----></span><br>I can confirm that even if these markers are turned on at the same time, they cannot be reproduced<span class="line"><!---->I can confirm that even if these markers are turned on at the same time, they cannot be reproduced<!----></span><br>--enable-blink-features=LayoutNGFlexFragmentation<span class="line"><!---->--enable-blink-features=LayoutNGFlexFragmentation<!----></span><br> --enable-blink-features=LayoutNGGridFragmentation<span class="line"><!----> --enable-blink-features=LayoutNGGridFragmentation<!----></span><br> --enable-blink-features=LayoutNGSubgrid<span class="line"><!----> --enable-blink-features=LayoutNGSubgrid<!----></span><br> --enable-blink-features=LayoutNGTableFragmentation<span class="line"><!----> --enable-blink-features=LayoutNGTableFragmentation<!----></span><br> --enable-blink-features=LayoutNGBlockInInline<span class="line"><!----> --enable-blink-features=LayoutNGBlockInInline<!----></span><br>  --enable-blink-features=LayoutNGBlockFragmentation<span class="line"><!---->  --enable-blink-features=LayoutNGBlockFragmentation<!----></span><br> --enable-blink-features=CSSContainerQueries<span class="line"><!----> --enable-blink-features=CSSContainerQueries<!----></span><br><br>2. <span class="line"><!---->2. <!----></span><br>It seems that the features required by the vulnerability are related to the features in feature1.png. Turn on all the flags mentioned above, and the content in feature1.png will not appear on the page.<span class="line"><!---->It seems that the features required by the vulnerability are related to the features in feature1.png. Turn on all the flags mentioned above, and the content in feature1.png will not appear on the page.<!----></span><br><br>3.<span class="line"><!---->3.<!----></span><br>Whether the vulnerability is reproduced has a lot to do with the execution of the following code. Analyzing the log records, it can be found that if it can be reproduced, the following code will crash immediately if it is executed(rep1.png). If not reproduced, the following code will be executed multiple times(notrep1.png).<span class="line"><!---->Whether the vulnerability is reproduced has a lot to do with the execution of the following code. Analyzing the log records, it can be found that if it can be reproduced, the following code will crash immediately if it is executed(rep1.png). If not reproduced, the following code will be executed multiple times(notrep1.png).<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><script id="code1" type="text/worklet"><span class="line"><!---->&lt;script id="code1" type="text/worklet"&gt;<!----></span><br>registerPaint('paintlet1', class {<span class="line"><!---->registerPaint('paintlet1', class {<!----></span><br>  static get inputProperties() { return ['--color']; }<span class="line"><!---->  static get inputProperties() { return ['--color']; }<!----></span><br>  paint(ctx, size, styleMap) {<span class="line"><!---->  paint(ctx, size, styleMap) {<!----></span><br>    (async function(arg_0,arg_1,arg_2){<span class="line"><!---->    (async function(arg_0,arg_1,arg_2){<!----></span><br>    /*[{"name":"arg_0","type":"PaintRenderingContext2D"},{"name":"arg_1","type":"any"},{"name":"arg_2","type":"StylePropertyMapReadOnly"}]*/<span class="line"><!---->    /*[{"name":"arg_0","type":"PaintRenderingContext2D"},{"name":"arg_1","type":"any"},{"name":"arg_2","type":"StylePropertyMapReadOnly"}]*/<!----></span><br>    console.log('-----------------registerPaint<int>--------------------');<span class="line"><!---->    console.log('-----------------registerPaint&lt;int&gt;--------------------');<!----></span><br>    console.log("---cb---idx-> 3");let arg_0_0 = arg_0;<span class="line"><!---->    console.log("---cb---idx-&gt; 3");let arg_0_0 = arg_0;<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>4.<span class="line"><!---->4.<!----></span><br>The failure of Clusterfuzz to reproduce may be due to the fact that there are many hard-coded URLs in the poc, which cannot be executed correctly in the Clusterfuzz environment. Here I provide a new Clusterfuzz-friendly test case(<span class="line"><!---->The failure of Clusterfuzz to reproduce may be due to the fact that there are many hard-coded URLs in the poc, which cannot be executed correctly in the Clusterfuzz environment. Here I provide a new Clusterfuzz-friendly test case(<!----></span>http://localhost:8000/fuzzer-testcases/fuzz-01.html<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="http://localhost:8000/fuzzer-testcases/fuzz-01.html"><!---->http://localhost:8000/fuzzer-testcases/fuzz-01.html<!----></a>)<span class="line"><!---->)<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        by

        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1270597#c18">Comment 18<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Mon, Nov 22, 2021, 11:37 AM EST"></chops-timestamp>
        
          <span class="role-label">Project Member</span>
      
        </div>
        
      <div role="heading" class="comment-header" aria-level="2">
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1270597#c18">Comment 18<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Mon, Nov 22, 2021, 11:37 AM EST"></chops-timestamp>
        
          <span class="role-label">Project Member</span>
      
        </div>
        
      </div>
    
      
        
      
        
          Labels:<strong><!---->Labels:</strong>
          
          -Security_Impact-Head -Security_Severity-High Security_Impact-None Security_Severity-Medium
          
          <br>
        
        
      <div class="issue-diff">
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Labels:</strong>
          
          -Security_Impact-Head -Security_Severity-High Security_Impact-None Security_Severity-Medium
          
          <br>
        <!---->
        
      </div><br>
    
        
      
        Yes, if the code can be reached by users (and those who may exploit that user), despite needing a flag to be enabled, this issue (a UAF in the renderer) should still be fixed. Because it is behind a command line flag, the impact can be changed to Security_Impact-None, meaning we in security aren't as concerned about the turnaround time for this fix. But it should should fix fixed before the test features this code is responsible for are enabled by default.  <span class="line"><!---->Yes, if the code can be reached by users (and those who may exploit that user), despite needing a flag to be enabled, this issue (a UAF in the renderer) should still be fixed. Because it is behind a command line flag, the impact can be changed to Security_Impact-None, meaning we in security aren't as concerned about the turnaround time for this fix. But it should should fix fixed before the test features this code is responsible for are enabled by default.  <!----></span><br><br>Also, because of the user interaction required to trigger, I've downgraded the severity from high to medium. I'm going to tag some security sheriffs on this to get concurrence and they are welcome to boost back up to high if they disagree.<span class="line"><!---->Also, because of the user interaction required to trigger, I've downgraded the severity from high to medium. I'm going to tag some security sheriffs on this to get concurrence and they are welcome to boost back up to high if they disagree.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>
    
      
    <mr-comment headinglevel="2" commenterismember=""></mr-comment>
      
      
      
        
          Comment 19<a class="comment-link" href="?id=1270597#c19">Comment 19<!----></a>

          
        by
        
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      schedule<i id="availability-icon" class="material-icons inline-icon ${user.last_visit_timestamp ? '': 'inline-icon-unseen'}" title="undefined" hidden="">schedule</i>

        Simple RCA<span class="line"><!---->Simple RCA<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>1. UpdateNGBlockLayout[2] call UpdateInFlowBlockLayout[1] created a scoped_refptr&lt;NGLayoutResult&gt; object<!----></span><br>2. But UpdateNGBlockLayout[2] did not save the returned temporary object, causing the temporary object to be freed<span class="line"><!---->2.         Tried with the arguments in the video:<span class="line"><!---->Tried with the arguments in the video:<!----></span><br>--js-flags='--expose_gc --allow-native-syntax' --no-sandbox --enable-blink-features=WebCodecs --enable-blink-test-features --disable-extensions --user-data-dir=test3<span class="line"><!---->--js-flags='--expose_gc --allow-native-syntax' --no-sandbox --enable-blink-features=WebCodecs --enable-blink-test-features --disable-extensions --user-data-dir=test3<!----></span><br><br>But I still can't reproduce locally.<span class="line"><!---->But I still can't reproduce locally.<!----></span><br><br>Clusterfuzz can't repro either, <span class="line"><!---->Clusterfuzz can't repro either, <!----></span>comment #13<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="#c13"><!---->comment #13<!----></a> says it's because it requires a user interaction, so we can't have a bisect. If not reproduced, the following code will be executed multiple times(notrep1.png).<span class="line"><!---->Whether the vulnerability is reproduced has a lot to do with the execution of the following code.           Labels:<strong><!---->Labels:</strong>

          <br>
        
        
      <div class="issue-diff">
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Labels:</strong>
          
          -Security_Impact-Head -Security_Severity-High Security_Impact-None Security_Severity-Medium
          
          <br>
        <!---->
        
      </div><br>
    
        
      
        Yes, if the code can be reached by users (and those who may exploit that user), despite needing a flag to be enabled, this issue (a UAF in the renderer) should still be fixed. Because it is behind a command line flag, the impact can be changed to Security_Impact-None, meaning we in security aren't as concerned about the turnaround time for this fix. But it should should fix fixed before the test features this code is responsible for are enabled by default.  <span class="line"><!---->Yes, if the code can be reached by users (and those who may exploit that user), despite needing a flag to be enabled, this issue (a UAF in the renderer) should still be fixed. Because it is behind a command line flag, the impact can be changed to Security_Impact-None, meaning we in security aren't as concerned about the turnaround time for this fix. But it should should fix fixed before the test features this code is responsible for are enabled by default.  <!----></span><br><br>Also, because of the user interaction required to trigger, I've downgraded the severity from high to medium. I'm going to tag some security sheriffs on this to get concurrence and they are welcome to boost back up to high if they disagree.<span class="line"><!---->Also, because of the user interaction required to trigger, I've downgraded the severity from high to medium. I'm going to tag some security sheriffs on this to get concurrence and they are welcome to boost back up to high if they disagree.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
