        re <span class="line"><!---->re <!----></span>#c26<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="#c26"><!---->#c26<!----></a> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span><br>I'm very sorry, poc does not require user interaction. The chances of reproducing on my local machines are about 50%. I provide some new information.<span class="line"><!---->I'm very sorry, poc does not require user interaction. The chances of reproducing on my local machines are about 50%. I provide some new information.<!----></span><br><br>1.<span class="line"><!---->1.<!----></span><br>I can confirm that even if these markers are turned on at the same time, they cannot be reproduced<span class="line"><!---->I can confirm that even if these markers are turned on at the same time, they cannot be reproduced<!----></span><br>--enable-blink-features=LayoutNGFlexFragmentation<span class="line"><!---->--enable-blink-features=LayoutNGFlexFragmentation<!----></span><br> --enable-blink-features=LayoutNGGridFragmentation<span class="line"><!----> --enable-blink-features=LayoutNGGridFragmentation<!----></span><br> --enable-blink-features=LayoutNGSubgrid<span class="line"><!----> --enable-blink-features=LayoutNGSubgrid<!----></span><br> --enable-blink-features=LayoutNGTableFragmentation<span class="line"><!----> --enable-blink-features=LayoutNGTableFragmentation<!----></span><br> --enable-blink-features=LayoutNGBlockInInline<span class="line"><!----> --enable-blink-features=LayoutNGBlockInInline<!----></span><br>  --enable-blink-features=LayoutNGBlockFragmentation<span class="line"><!---->  --enable-blink-features=LayoutNGBlockFragmentation<!----></span><br> --enable-blink-features=CSSContainerQueries<span class="line"><!----> --enable-blink-features=CSSContainerQueries<!----></span><br><br>2. <span class="line"><!---->2. <!----></span><br>It seems that the features required by the vulnerability are related to the features in feature1.png. Turn on all the flags mentioned above, and the content in feature1.png will not appear on the page.<span class="line"><!---->It seems that the features required by the vulnerability are related to the features in feature1.png. Turn on all the flags mentioned above, and the content in feature1.png will not appear on the page.<!----></span><br><br>3.<span class="line"><!---->3.<!----></span><br>Whether the vulnerability is reproduced has a lot to do with the execution of the following code. Analyzing the log records, it can be found that if it can be reproduced, the following code will crash immediately if it is executed(rep1.png). If not reproduced, the following code will be executed multiple times(notrep1.png).<span class="line"><!---->Whether the vulnerability is reproduced has a lot to do with the execution of the following code. Analyzing the log records, it can be found that if it can be reproduced, the following code will crash immediately if it is executed(rep1.png). If not reproduced, the following code will be executed multiple times(notrep1.png).<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><script id="code1" type="text/worklet"><span class="line"><!---->&lt;script id="code1" type="text/worklet"&gt;<!----></span><br>registerPaint('paintlet1', class {<span class="line"><!---->registerPaint('paintlet1', class {<!----></span><br>  static get inputProperties() { return ['--color']; }<span class="line"><!---->  static get inputProperties() { return ['--color']; }<!----></span><br>  paint(ctx, size, styleMap) {<span class="line"><!---->  paint(ctx, size, styleMap) {<!----></span><br>    (async function(arg_0,arg_1,arg_2){<span class="line"><!---->    (async function(arg_0,arg_1,arg_2){<!----></span><br>    /*[{"name":"arg_0","type":"PaintRenderingContext2D"},{"name":"arg_1","type":"any"},{"name":"arg_2","type":"StylePropertyMapReadOnly"}]*/<span class="line"><!---->    /*[{"name":"arg_0","type":"PaintRenderingContext2D"},{"name":"arg_1","type":"any"},{"name":"arg_2","type":"StylePropertyMapReadOnly"}]*/<!----></span><br>    console.log('-----------------registerPaint<int>--------------------');<span class="line"><!---->    console.log('-----------------registerPaint&lt;int&gt;--------------------');<!----></span><br>    console.log("---cb---idx-> 3");let arg_0_0 = arg_0;<span class="line"><!---->    console.log("---cb---idx-&gt; 3");let arg_0_0 = arg_0;<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>4.<span class="line"><!---->4.<!----></span><br>The failure of Clusterfuzz to reproduce may be due to the fact that there are many hard-coded URLs in the poc, which cannot be executed correctly in the Clusterfuzz environment. Here I provide a new Clusterfuzz-friendly test case(<span class="line"><!---->The failure of Clusterfuzz to reproduce may be due to the fact that there are many hard-coded URLs in the poc, which cannot be executed correctly in the Clusterfuzz environment.     <mr-issue-details class="main-item"><!---->
      <style>
        mr-issue-details {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);

          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;

          Labels:<strong><!---->Labels:</strong>
          
          -Security_Impact-Head -Security_Severity-High Security_Impact-None Security_Severity-Medium
          
          <br>
        
        
      <div class="issue-diff">
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Labels:</strong>
          
          -Security_Impact-Head -Security_Severity-High Security_Impact-None Security_Severity-Medium
          
          <br>
        <!---->
        
      </div><br>
    
        
      
        Yes, if the code can be reached by users (and those who may exploit that user), despite needing a flag to be enabled, this issue (a UAF in the renderer) should still be fixed. Because it is behind a command line flag, the impact can be changed to Security_Impact-None, meaning we in security aren't as concerned about the turnaround time for this fix. But it should should fix fixed before the test features this code is responsible for are enabled by default.  <span class="line"><!---->Yes, if the code can be reached by users (and those who may exploit that user), despite needing a flag to be enabled, this issue (a UAF in the renderer) should still be fixed. Because it is behind a command line flag, the impact can be changed to Security_Impact-None, meaning we in security aren't as concerned about the turnaround time for this fix. But it should should fix fixed before the test features this code is responsible for are enabled by default.  <!----></span><br><br>Also, because of the user interaction required to trigger, I've downgraded the severity from high to medium. I'm going to tag some security sheriffs on this to get concurrence and they are welcome to boost back up to high if they disagree.<span class="line"><!---->Also, because of the user interaction required to trigger, I've downgraded the severity from high to medium. I'm going to tag some security sheriffs on this to get concurrence and they are welcome to boost back up to high if they disagree.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>

        Simple RCA<span class="line"><!---->Simple RCA<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>1. UpdateNGBlockLayout[2] call UpdateInFlowBlockLayout[1] created a scoped_refptr<NGLayoutResult> object<span class="line"><!---->1. UpdateNGBlockLayout[2] call UpdateInFlowBlockLayout[1] created a scoped_refptr&lt;NGLayoutResult&gt; object<!----></span><br>2. But UpdateNGBlockLayout[2] did not save the returned temporary object, causing the temporary object to be freed<span class="line"><!---->2. But UpdateNGBlockLayout[2] did not save the returned temporary object, causing the temporary object to be freed<!----></span><br>3. PaintLayerFragment[3] hold a raw pointer of NGPhysicalBoxFragment,cause this UAF issue<span class="line"><!---->3. PaintLayerFragment[3] hold a raw pointer of NGPhysicalBoxFragment,cause this UAF issue<!----></span><br><br>[1]<span class="line"><!---->[1]<!----></span><br>third_party/blink/renderer/core/layout/ng/layout_ng_mixin.cc:390<span class="line"><!---->third_party/blink/renderer/core/layout/ng/layout_ng_mixin.cc:390<!----></span><br>template <typename Base><span class="line"><!---->template &lt;typename Base&gt;<!----></span><br>scoped_refptr<const NGLayoutResult><span class="line"><!---->scoped_refptr&lt;const NGLayoutResult&gt;<!----></span><br>LayoutNGMixin<Base>::UpdateInFlowBlockLayout() {<span class="line"><!---->LayoutNGMixin&lt;Base&gt;::UpdateInFlowBlockLayout() {<!----></span><br><br>...CUT...<span class="line"><!---->...CUT...<!----></span><br><br>  scoped_refptr<const NGLayoutResult> result =<span class="line"><!---->  scoped_refptr&lt;const NGLayoutResult&gt; result =<!----></span><br>      NGBlockNode(this).Layout(constraint_space);<span class="line"><!---->      NGBlockNode(this).Layout(constraint_space);<!----></span><br><br>...CUT...<span class="line"><!---->...CUT...<!----></span><br><br>  return result;<span class="line"><!---->  return result;<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br><br>[2]<span class="line"><!---->[2]<!----></span><br>third_party/blink/renderer/core/layout/ng/layout_ng_block_flow_mixin.cc:264<span         re <span class="line"><!---->re <!----></span>#c26<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="#c26"><!---->#c26<!----></a> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span><br>I'm very sorry, poc does not require user interaction. The chances of reproducing on my local machines are about 50%. I provide some new information.<span class="line"><!---->I'm very sorry, poc does not require user interaction. The chances of reproducing on my local machines are about 50%. I provide some new information.<!----></span><br><br>1.<span class="line"><!---->1.<!----></span><br>I can confirm that even if these markers are turned on at the same time, they cannot be reproduced<span class="line"><!---->I can confirm that even if these markers are turned on at the same time, they cannot be reproduced<!----></span><br>--enable-blink-features=LayoutNGFlexFragmentation<span class="line"><!---->--enable-blink-features=LayoutNGFlexFragmentation<!----></span><br> --enable-blink-features=LayoutNGGridFragmentation<span class="line"><!----> --enable-blink-features=LayoutNGGridFragmentation<!----></span><br> --enable-blink-features=LayoutNGSubgrid<span class="line"><!----> --enable-blink-features=LayoutNGSubgrid<!----></span><br> --enable-blink-features=LayoutNGTableFragmentation<span class="line"><!----> --enable-blink-features=LayoutNGTableFragmentation<!----></span><br> --enable-blink-features=LayoutNGBlockInInline<span class="line"><!----> --enable-blink-features=LayoutNGBlockInInline<!----></span><br>  --enable-blink-features=LayoutNGBlockFragmentation<span class="line"><!---->  --enable-blink-features=LayoutNGBlockFragmentation<!----></span><br> --enable-blink-features=CSSContainerQueries<span class="line"><!----> --enable-blink-features=CSSContainerQueries<!----></span><br><br>2. <span class="line"><!---->2. <!----></span><br>It seems that the features required by the vulnerability are related to the features in feature1.png. Turn on all the flags mentioned above, and the content in feature1.png will not appear on the page.<span class="line"><!---->It seems that the features required by the vulnerability are related to the features in feature1.png. Turn on all the flags mentioned above, and the content in feature1.png will not appear on the page.<!----></span><br><br>3.<span class="line"><!---->3.<!----></span><br>Whether the vulnerability is reproduced has a lot to do with the execution of the following code. Analyzing the log records, it can be found that if it can be reproduced, the following code will crash immediately if it is executed(rep1.png). If not reproduced, the following code will be executed multiple times(notrep1.png).<span class="line"><!---->Whether the vulnerability is reproduced has a lot to do with the execution of the following code. Analyzing the log records, it can be found that if it can be reproduced, the following code will crash immediately if it is executed(rep1.png). If not reproduced, the following code will be executed multiple times(notrep1.png).<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><script id="code1" type="text/worklet"><span class="line"><!---->&lt;script id="code1" type="text/worklet"&gt;<!----></span><br>registerPaint('paintlet1', class {<span class="line"><!---->registerPaint('paintlet1', class {<!----></span><br>  static get inputProperties() { return ['--color']; }<span class="line"><!---->  static get inputProperties() { return ['--color']; }<!----></span><br>  paint(ctx, size, styleMap) {<span class="line"><!---->  paint(ctx, size, styleMap) {<!----></span><br>    (async function(arg_0,arg_1,arg_2){<span class="line"><!---->    (async function(arg_0,arg_1,arg_2){<!----></span><br>    /*[{"name":"arg_0","type":"PaintRenderingContext2D"},{"name":"arg_1","type":"any"},{"name":"arg_2","type":"StylePropertyMapReadOnly"}]*/<span class="line"><!---->    /*[{"name":"arg_0","type":"PaintRenderingContext2D"},{"name":"arg_1","type":"any"},{"name":"arg_2","type":"StylePropertyMapReadOnly"}]*/<!----></span><br>    console.log('-----------------registerPaint<int>--------------------');<span class="line"><!---->    console.log('-----------------registerPaint&lt;int&gt;--------------------');<!----></span><br>    console.log("---cb---idx-> 3");let arg_0_0 = arg_0;<span class="line"><!---->    console.log("---cb---idx-&gt; 3");let arg_0_0 = arg_0;<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>4.<span class="line"><!---->4.<!----></span><br>The failure of Clusterfuzz to reproduce may be due to the fact that there are many hard-coded URLs in the poc, which cannot be executed correctly in the Clusterfuzz environment. Here I provide a new Clusterfuzz-friendly test case(<span class="line"><!---->The failure of Clusterfuzz to reproduce may be due to the fact that there are many hard-coded URLs in the poc, which cannot be executed correctly in the Clusterfuzz environment. Here I provide a new Clusterfuzz-friendly test case(<!----></span>http://localhost:8000/fuzzer-testcases/fuzz-01.html<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="http://localhost:8000/fuzzer-testcases/fuzz-01.html"><!---->http://localhost:8000/fuzzer-testcases/fuzz-01.html<!----></a>)<span class="line"><!---->)<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

          Labels:<strong><!---->Labels:</strong>

          <br>
        
        
      <div class="issue-diff">
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Labels:</strong>
          
          -Security_Impact-Head -Security_Severity-High Security_Impact-None Security_Severity-Medium
          
          <br>
        <!---->
        
      </div><br>
    
        
      
        Yes, if the code can be reached by users (and those who may exploit that user), despite needing a flag to be enabled, this issue (a UAF in the renderer) should still be fixed. Because it is behind a command line flag, the impact can be changed to Security_Impact-None, meaning we in security aren't as concerned about the turnaround time for this fix. But it should should fix fixed before the test features this code is responsible for are enabled by default.  <span class="line"><!---->Yes, if the code can be reached by users (and those who may exploit that user), despite needing a flag to be enabled, this issue (a UAF in the renderer) should still be fixed. Because it is behind a command line flag, the impact can be changed to Security_Impact-None, meaning we in security aren't as concerned about the turnaround time for this fix. But it should should fix fixed before the test features this code is responsible for are enabled by default.  <!----></span><br><br>Also, because of the user interaction required to trigger, I've downgraded the severity from high to medium. I'm going to tag some security sheriffs on this to get concurrence and they are welcome to boost back up to high if they disagree.<span class="line"><!---->Also, because of the user interaction required to trigger, I've downgraded the severity from high to medium. I'm going to tag some security sheriffs on this to get concurrence and they are welcome to boost back up to high if they disagree.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        re <span class="line"><!---->re <!----></span>#c26<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="#c26"><!---->#c26<!----></a> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span><br>I'm very sorry, poc does not require user interaction. The chances of reproducing on my local machines are about 50%. I provide some new information.<span class="line"><!---->I'm very sorry, poc does not require user interaction. The chances of reproducing on my local machines are about 50%. I provide some new information.<!----></span><br><br>1.<span class="line"><!---->1.<!----></span><br>I can confirm that even if these markers are turned on at the same time, they cannot be reproduced<span class="line"><!---->I can confirm that even if these markers are turned on at the same time, they cannot be reproduced<!----></span><br>--enable-blink-features=LayoutNGFlexFragmentation<span class="line"><!---->--enable-blink-features=LayoutNGFlexFragmentation<!----></span><br> --enable-blink-features=LayoutNGGridFragmentation<span class="line"><!----> --enable-blink-features=LayoutNGGridFragmentation<!----></span><br> --enable-blink-features=LayoutNGSubgrid<span class="line"><!----> --enable-blink-features=LayoutNGSubgrid<!----></span><br> --enable-blink-features=LayoutNGTableFragmentation<span class="line"><!----> --enable-blink-features=LayoutNGTableFragmentation<!----></span><br> --enable-blink-features=LayoutNGBlockInInline<span class="line"><!----> --enable-blink-features=LayoutNGBlockInInline<!----></span><br>  --enable-blink-features=LayoutNGBlockFragmentation<span class="line"><!---->  --enable-blink-features=LayoutNGBlockFragmentation<!----></span><br> --enable-blink-features=CSSContainerQueries<span class="line"><!----> --enable-blink-features=CSSContainerQueries<!----></span><br><br>2. <span class="line"><!---->2. <!----></span><br>It seems that the features required by the vulnerability are related to the features in feature1.png. Turn on all the flags mentioned above, and the content in feature1.png will not appear on the page.<span class="line"><!---->It seems that the features required by the vulnerability are related to the features in feature1.png. Turn on all the flags mentioned above, and the content in feature1.png will not appear on the page.<!----></span><br><br>3.<span class="line"><!---->3.<!----></span><br>Whether the vulnerability is reproduced has a lot to do with the execution of the following code. Analyzing the log records, it can be found that if it can be reproduced, the following code will crash immediately if it is executed(rep1.png). If not reproduced, the following code will be executed multiple times(notrep1.png).<span class="line"><!---->Whether the vulnerability is reproduced has a lot to do with the execution of the following code. Analyzing the log records, it can be found that if it can be reproduced, the following code will crash immediately if it is executed(rep1.png). If not reproduced, the following code will be executed multiple times(notrep1.png).<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><script id="code1" type="text/worklet"><span class="line"><!---->&lt;script id="code1" type="text/worklet"&gt;<!----></span><br>registerPaint('paintlet1', class {<span class="line"><!---->registerPaint('paintlet1', class {<!----></span><br>  static get inputProperties() { return ['--color']; }<span class="line"><!---->  static get inputProperties() { return ['--color']; }<!----></span><br>  paint(ctx, size, styleMap) {<span class="line"><!---->  paint(ctx, size, styleMap) {<!----></span><br>    (async function(arg_0,arg_1,arg_2){<span class="line"><!---->    (async function(arg_0,arg_1,arg_2){<!----></span><br>    /*[{"name":"arg_0","type":"PaintRenderingContext2D"},{"name":"arg_1","type":"any"},{"name":"arg_2","type":"StylePropertyMapReadOnly"}]*/<span class="line"><!---->    /*[{"name":"arg_0","type":"PaintRenderingContext2D"},{"name":"arg_1","type":"any"},{"name":"arg_2","type":"StylePropertyMapReadOnly"}]*/<!----></span><br>    console.log('-----------------registerPaint<int>--------------------');<span class="line"><!---->    console.log('-----------------registerPaint&lt;int&gt;--------------------');<!----></span><br>    console.log("---cb---idx-> 3");let arg_0_0 = arg_0;<span class="line"><!---->    console.log("---cb---idx-&gt; 3");let arg_0_0 = arg_0;<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>4.<span class="line"><!---->4.<!----></span><br>The failure of Clusterfuzz to reproduce may be due to the fact that there are many hard-coded URLs in the poc, which cannot be executed correctly in the Clusterfuzz environment. Here I provide a new Clusterfuzz-friendly test case(<span class="line"><!---->The failure of Clusterfuzz to reproduce may be due to the fact that there are many hard-coded URLs in the poc, which cannot be executed correctly in the Clusterfuzz environment.           align-items: stretch;
        }
        mr-launch-overview[hidden] {
          display: none;
        }
        mr-phase {
          margin-bottom: 0.75em;
        }
      </style>

           issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

        for LitElement.

 runOnLoad(function() {
 if (typeof(ClientLogger) === "function") {
 let cl = new ClientLogger("issues");
 if (cl.started("new-issue")) {
 cl.logEnd("new-issue", null, 120 * 1000);
 }
 if (cl.started("issue-search")) {
 cl.logEnd("issue-search");
 }
 }
 });
<script type="text/javascript" nonce="">
 runOnLoad(function() {
 if (typeof(ClientLogger) === "function") {
 let cl = new ClientLogger("issues");
 if (cl.started("new-issue")) {
 cl.logEnd("new-issue", null, 120 * 1000);
 }
 if (cl.started("issue-search")) {
 cl.logEnd("issue-search");
 }
 }
 });
</script>
